We, arv global creations private limited faridabad haryana India, are a distinguished garment manufacturing and export unit based in India, specializing in the creation of authentically designed "high-fashion beaded garments, partywear, and bridal dresses" alongwith "western dresses crafted with or without embellishments". Our commitment to excellence and precision has garnered us widespread acclaim in key overseas markets, including russia, usa, canada, germany, uk, australia, and denmark. At arv global creations, we pride ourselves on being a b2b-centric entity, exclusively catering to overseas markets while maintaining a notable absence in the Indian market. This unique focus enables us to devote our entire energy to meeting the discerning demands of our international clients. Our expertise lies in the seamless synthesis of traditional artistry with contemporary design, resulting in garments that embody sophistication, glamour, and unparalleled craftsmanship. Craftsmanship beyond borders: Our forte lies in the creation of high-fashion beaded garments, partywear, and bridal dresses that transcend cultural boundaries. Whether it's the intricate detailing of beaded embellishments or the subtle elegance of non-beaded western garments, our versatile offerings cater to the diverse tastes of our esteemed clientele. Tailored to perfection: At arv global creations, we pride ourselves on our adaptability and client-centric approach. Our highly experienced team is adept at bringing your visions to life, whether it be through original designs, modifications, or replication of inspired pieces. We offer a comprehensive suite of services, ranging from sampling to bulk production, ensuring that every garment meets and exceeds your expectations. Materials of distinction: The foundation of our garments lies in the careful selection of materials. We exclusively utilize viscose georgette, power mesh, and tulle fabrics for our bridal and partywear high-fashion garments, ensuring not only aesthetic appeal but also ease of handling and management. The beading materials, sourced from industry-renowned suppliers like kbc and bbc, epitomize quality that resonates not only in the Indian market but throughout the world. Seamless production process: Our commitment to perfection extends beyond design and materials to our meticulous production process. Upon receiving your taste, preferences, and detailed measurements, we seamlessly integrate your requirements into our design and tech pack. Swatches or a single sample dress are presented for approval, ensuring that your vision aligns seamlessly with our execution. Bulk material procurement follows the approval, a testament to our dedication to precision and efficiency. Each step in our production process is meticulously synchronized to eliminate any room for error, from the initial design concept to the final garment, preserving the quality of the fabric throughout. A global footprint: Our garments have left an indelible mark in international markets, with particular acclaim in sydney where our designs and meticulous packaging have been lauded by discerning buyers. The "fire in the forest" analogy aptly captures the fervour with which our popularity has spread, setting us apart as a unique designer in the global market. Collaborative opportunities: We are enthusiastic about the prospect of showcasing our designer garments to your esteemed organization. The opportunity to collaborate represents a symbiotic relationship where our expertise and unique designs can elevate your offerings, bringing mutual benefits without the need for third-party involvement. In just four years since our inception, we had the privilege of producing for esteemed names in the industry, including karen willis holmes, rachel gilbert, rayon patros, and more. Our rapid growth is a testament to the quality and commitment that define our company. We would be honoured to share a curated selection of our designs providing you a glimpse into the artistry that defines arv global creations. We believe that this exploration will resonate with your discerning taste and potentially open avenues for a fruitful partnership. We are eagerly anticipating the opportunity to connect and discuss how we can contribute to the enhancement of your fashion portfolio.
49d, Hazra Road, Kolkata 700019 West Bengal India

Butterfly clothing company stands as a beacon of style, sophistication, and innovation in the high fashion ladies wear industry. Established by a visionary woman with an unwavering passion for the garment industry, simran kathuria, our brand is a testament to the seamless fusion of Indian artistry and modern aesthetics. We specialize in handwork embroidery and threadwork, meticulously blending traditional craftsmanship with contemporary designs to create garments that embody grace, elegance, and cultural richness. Crafting excellence: specialization in handwork embroidery and threadwork At butterfly clothing company, we take pride in our specialization in handwork embroidery and threadwork. Our skilled artisans, trained in time-honored techniques, infuse each garment with a touch of craftsmanship that is unparalleled. From delicate zardozi to intricate mirror work, our handcrafted pieces narrate stories of tradition, culture, and timeless elegance. The fusion wear philosophy: marrying tradition with modernity Our brand is distinguished by its commitment to fusing traditional Indian art with modern wear. The fusion wear philosophy at butterfly clothing company is not just a design ethos but a celebration of diversity, blending the rich tapestry of Indian art with contemporary styles. Each collection reflects a harmonious convergence of colors, patterns, and textures, creating garments that resonate with women who appreciate the beauty of cultural amalgamation. Signature styles: where heritage meets haute couture Our collections boast signature styles that seamlessly weave together the old and the new. Whether it's the resplendent bridal wear adorned with intricate handwork or the chic casual wear that effortlessly captures the essence of modern living, every garment at butterfly clothing company is a work of art. Our commitment to quality, craftsmanship, and innovation ensures that each piece is not just a garment but a statement of individuality. Global inspiration, local craftsmanship Drawing inspiration from global fashion trends while staying rooted in local craftsmanship, butterfly clothing company has carved a niche as a brand that transcends borders. Our garments are a testament to the universality of beauty, celebrating the diversity of cultures and traditions that influence our designs. Whether it's a runway in paris or an intimate gathering in mumbai, our creations resonate with women who appreciate the artistry that transcends geographical boundaries. Sustainable fashion: a commitment to ethical practices As advocates of sustainable fashion, butterfly clothing company is committed to ethical practices at every stage of production. We source our materials responsibly, ensuring that our garments not only embody beauty but also a sense of responsibility towards the environment and our community. Our dedication to sustainability is reflected in our timeless designs that withstand fleeting trends, promoting a more conscious approach to fashion. Vision for the future: redefining elegance, one stitch at a time Looking ahead, butterfly clothing company envisions a future where elegance is redefined, and cultural richness is celebrated through every stitch. We aspire to be a global leader in high fashion ladies wear, continuing to innovate, inspire, and preserve the legacy of Indian craftsmanship. With an unwavering commitment to excellence and a passion for beauty, butterfly clothing company invites you to join us on this enchanting journey where tradition meets modernity in every garment we create.
H1 193 Apparel Parkjagatpura, Jaipur 302025 Rajasthan India

Bluebeam technical support menu How can we help you? Search for solutions and workflows Common topics: learn about studio, create & save custom markups, using ocr How to export, import, and manage profiles This article applies to: Revu 20 Revu 2019 Revu 2018 Jump to other versions: Revu 2017 and older Profiles provide an easy way to store your favorite toolbars, menus and other display settings within revu. Like tool sets, you can export your custom profiles and then add or import them to another user’s copy of revu. In addition to profiles, you can customize tool sets and stamps within revu to best suit your needs. Exporting a profile To export a profile: Go to revu > profiles > manage profiles , or click profiles in the lower right corner of the navigation bar. Select the profile that you’d like to share, then click export. The profile will be saved as a .Bpx file that can be emailed or uploaded to a shared network drive or any other file sharing system. If you check the box marked include dependencies before exporting, then revu will include tool sets, bookmark structures (extreme only), hatch patterns and line styles in the exported profile. Upon importing the profile back to revu, these dependencies will be included as well. Click ok. Importing a profile To import a profile to revu: Go to revu > profiles > manage profiles , or click profiles in the lower right corner of the navigation bar. Click the import button to copy the .Bpx file to the file path found in the location: field. You can go to this designated folder to remove or copy profiles as needed. Click ok. Manage your profiles To manage your profiles: Go to revu > profiles > manage profiles , or click profiles in the lower right-hand corner of the navigation bar. Click the modify button and enter the new name for that profile. Click ok.

About us Ashoka international a govt recognised export house based in calcutta, India, with a rich history dating back to its establishment in 1987 by h.D. Bang. With a vast experience in the export/import business since 1969, the company has grown into a reputable player in the global market, specializing in the production and distribution of a diverse range of products, including scarves, stoles, shawls, hand-painted leather goods, and jute products. Our products The company's initial focus was on manufacturing and exporting scarves, stoles, and shawls. Calcutta, renowned for its exclusive handwoven and handloom techniques, became the hub for crafting these exquisite products. Ashoka international capitalized on this expertise and leveraged the city's skilled artisans to create exceptional pieces highly sought after worldwide. The products are made from various materials, such as pure silk, cotton (both normal and organic), linen (made from european flax), wool (australian merino wool), acrylic, or blends of these materials. The production process involves different modes of printing, including hand screen printing, hand-painting, and digital printing, often combined with hand and machine embroidery and other embellishments. This meticulous attention to detail and craftsmanship ensures that each product is of the highest quality. In 1994, noesh bang, the son of h.D. Bang, joined the company, injecting fresh ideas and expanding the business to new horizons. Recognizing the demand for unique, handcrafted leather goods, ashoka international introduced a line of hand-painted sheepskin leather products. This collection includes coin purses, bags, pouches, and wallets, which serve as a testament to the traditional craftmanship of kolkata and its surrounding regions. Each piece is carefully hand-painted, showcasing intricate designs and vibrant colors that captivate customers worldwide. Additionally, ashoka international ventured into the production of jute products. Jute, a tropical plant with lustrous golden fibers and high tensile strength, was initially used as a traditional packaging material. However, the company's innovative spirit led them to transform jute into high-quality fashion products that can be found in some of the finest stores worldwide. The jute bags produced by ashoka international are known for their strength, attractive prints, vibrant colors, and eco-friendliness. These bags have become an appealing alternative to plastic and paper bags, aligning with the global movement towards sustainability. Ashoka international's core strengths lie in their expertise in printing and fabrication techniques. They have mastered the art of working with natural fibers such as canvas, straw, and hemp, allowing them to create unique designs and innovative products. The company's constant experimentation with materials and product development opens up new possibilities, enabling them to stay at the forefront of market trends. One of the key factors contributing to ashoka international's success is their collaboration with traditional weavers, artisans, and workers. These skilled individuals, who have inherited their expertise through generations, play a crucial role in the company's operations. Their insights and craftsmanship are invaluable in maintaining the authenticity and quality of ashoka international's products. The company's commitment to preserving traditional techniques while embracing contemporary design trends distinguishes them in the market. Our market Ashoka international has established a strong presence in the global market, with europe representing their largest customer base, accounting for 50% of their market share. They have cultivated partnerships with major chain stores in europe, supplying their products to discerning customers. In japan, the company works closely with various brands through trading companies and wholesalers, securing a significant market share of 30%. Additionally, ashoka international serves customers in the usa, australia, and other parts of the world, making up 20% of their market. In conclusion, ashoka international is a highly regarded company with a rich heritage in the export/import business. Their specialization in scarves, stoles, shawls, hand-painted leather goods, and jute products has garnered them a strong reputation in the global market. By combining traditional craftsmanship with innovative designs and sustainable practices, ashoka international continues to deliver high-quality, unique products that cater to the diverse tastes of customers worldwide.
Panchsheel Pratishtha Tower 2, 901 Sector 75, Noida 201301 Uttar Pradesh India

Bapna projects pvt. Ltd. (Bppl), established in 1995, has been involved in the business of constructions and garment manufacturing in jaipur, India. From the initial focus on constructions, the company shifted its focus on garment manufacturing since 2018. Bppl is manufacturing garments for some very prestigious brands in India like jadeblue lifestyle, jaypore.Com, seasons, bagh India, thevasa, tribal valley, etc. Manufacturing is done as per customer requirements, specifications and measurements. Garments are also manufactured in the name and style of aanetos and jaipurcottons. Currently, the manufacturing facility is situated at sitapura industrial estate in jaipur, India on a land area of 1950 sqm and built-up area of approx. 880 Sqm. The factory has all basic facilities for work men and women, such as drinking water facility, clean toilets, adequate lighting system, first aid, safety & security, cctv, etc. The facility includes fabric storage, finished goods storage, cutting tables with required equipment, sewing machines and skilled labour for the same, skilled labour for hand work, thread trimming facility and personnel, ironing facility, sampling, pattern making, finishing and packing. Jaipur, the pinkcity, is well known world over for its traditional textile printing. The traditional art of textile printing is done, using wooden blocks by hand by extremely skilled crafts men and women in the suburbs of jaipur, namely sanganer and bagru. The colours used are created out of natural products using age old methodology. This craft has been passed on from generation to generation. There are a few very highly skilled and experienced craftsmen associated with us for textile printing. The company is managed by mr. Sanjay bapna, who has a post graduate degree in management studies and an experience of 34 years in various fields of management and marketing and mr. Rishabh bapna, who has a degree in business administration and an experience of 4 years. They are assisted by adequate experienced managerial staff and a senior professional expert master, who has an experience of 30 years in garment manufacturing. Bppl philosophy is to achieve quality excellence in processes and product. Timely delivery of goods with desired quality to customer’s satisfaction is the motto. Our major working is done on 100 % cotton (60’s count), we buy the greige fabric from the leading fabric manufactures of the country. With the greige fabric we treat it and remove the starch from the fabric and we make it ready for dye or printing. We have many job workers associated with whom we do dye and printing, and majorly we do hand block printing, which is a natural process and this art comes through a town near jaipur known as bagru. Picture of blocks used for printing Picture of block printing on fabric We have our own garment manufacturing unit in which we start which checking of fabric if there is a misprint or if fabric is torn, colour bleeding etc., Then we start with cutting of the fabric depending upon the design finalized. Bulk cutting is done through size wise patterns of the design, every design & every size has a pattern according to the measurement sheet we are following. After cutting, the material goes under stitching following the pattern from which the cutting is done. Quality of stitching is very important, so we keep very frequent check on stitching and measurements of the garment. After stitching material goes through some work, like hand or machine, then the material comes in finishing which includes thread cutting, initial check of the garment, if there is any alteration needed or it has some stains, then the garment goes for final checking in which its checked for marks, threads alterations, spotting, etc., The after the ironing of the garment, the garment is checked for measurement and then it is packed for dispatch. Pattern making Bulk cutting using patterns We have associate who have various type of printing facility such as hand block printing, screen printing & digital printing. Different techniques are used for printing depending upon the output desired. Bapna projects pvt. Ltd., F – 714, off i. Kloud knit mill ltd, located in tirupur, is a manufacturer of knitted garments. We specialize in utilizing the unutilized capacity within the knit garment manufacturing value chain, thereby offering our b2b customers a unique and seamless manufacturing experience. Our approach involves aggregating, integrating, facilitating, and connecting the right suppliers in the knit garment value chain to our b2b customers. By doing so, we create value for both our knit suppliers and customers, ensuring a mutually beneficial relationship. In tirupur, there is a significant amount of unutilized capacity across various stages of the knit garment manufacturing process, including spinning, knitting, processing, and cut-to-pack units. These inefficiencies arise from issues such as waiting for materials, unnecessary changeovers, lower production efficiency, and limited orders. At kloud knit mill, we address these challenges by introducing value chain transparency and streamlining operations. We work closely with our suppliers, aligning their strengths with the specific product requirements of our customers. This strategic approach minimizes downtime and maximizes productivity, resulting in optimized production efficiency. Additionally, our technical assistance and support enable our suppliers to overcome challenges and enhance their manufacturing capabilities. At kloud knit mill, we leverage machine data analytics, including descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics, to gain valuable insights into production processes. This data-driven approach helps us identify bottlenecks, forecast demand, and make informed decisions, ensuring efficient operations and timely delivery. Our commitment is to deliver the right quality garments to our customers at transparent and competitive prices. We understand the importance of timely delivery in the fast-paced fashion industry, and our streamlined processes and optimized supply chain enable us to meet shorter lead times. Join us at kloud knit mill and experience the benefits of our integrated and customer-centric approach. Together, we can deliver high-quality knitted garments with transparency, efficiency, and competitive pricing, ensuring customer satisfaction and long-term partnerships.

K.M knitwear pvt ltd, a success story on apparel exports from India Shri k.M. Subramanian, founder and chairman of the km group of companies in tirupur, has three decades of expertise in the textile sector. His humility, clarity, daring dexterity in challenging environments and his leadership qualities have been instrumental in making him one among the top in, what is a highly competitive textile industry. Today, the km group of companies is environmental friendly with fully vertical infrastructure facilities from fibre to fashion. Under his leadership, the company has scaled new heights and become top ten exporters in tirupur. He started km knitwear in 1993 with an investment of rs.1 Lakh in the garment business, in 1997 started exporting garments with an annual turnover of 2 crores which was his first turn around moment. To compete in the world market, he planned to make k m knitwear group as a one stop solution for all fashion needs. In 2003, he started the spinning division and in 2008, he started his own processing and printing division in the name of jeyavishnu clothing private limited. Since then, a corrugation box manufacturing unit and 10 garment manufacturing units were continuously set up to cater the needs of growing business. The entire business is monitored by centralised erp system. Now, km stands tall with a capacity of 6500 sewing machines manufacturing 25 lakh garments per month, 72000 spindles of spinning capacity with yarn and processing output of 50 tonnes a day with an annual turnover of rs.850 Crores. We have invested more than 100 crores in the recent years for environmental sustainability and green energy which is 25% of our capital investment. To reduce the carbon foot print k.M.Knitwear has installed 30 mw of windmill and solar power and planned to be carbon neutral company very soon. To make our planet green, in 2017 we joined hands with vanathukkul tirupur and planted 11,000 saplings in our land at ponnapuram village, and 6000 saplings at pongulur and maintaining it well till date. Our processing unit was one of the very few to receive the coveted “green award 2018” from the tamilnadu government for its sustainable and environment-friendly operations. Giving employment to more than 7000 workers,70% of the entire work force are women employees and in that 20% of women take various leadership roles. We provide extensive training to new employees and constantly conduct skill development program to our existing workers. We provide higher and college education to our work force and also incentive them regularly based on their performance. To match the current world market trend and a continuous effort to diversify within the business, we are slowly shifting from manufacturing traditional cotton garments to conventional, recycled and mmf. To be part of global supply chain, all our groups are certified with oeko tex, gots, grs, ocs, iso 9001,14001 and 45001, sedex, higg index, swan and wrap to name a few. Two of our factories are green factory certified with platinum rating.
